content:
Gittel Miller's (daughter of Moshe Shamshon Scheindlin) Tombstone



Tombstone of Gittel, wife of Avrohm Miller and daughter of Moshe Shamshon Scheindlin.
This tombstone stands in Vranov nad Taplou and loosely translates from #90 on Bobby Furst's list:
Here is buried a modest God-fearing woman, her hand and heart were wide open to the poor; she suffered hardship at the end of her life, Gittel daughter of R' Moshe Shimshon of blessed memory, wife of the leader R. Avraham Miller of blessed memory, died at a ripe old age on 5 Tishrei 5689 = September 19, 1928 


____________________________________________________________
Date: Sat, 22 Jan 2000 23:47:27 -0800 
From: Bobby Furst <bobby1st@sprynet.com> 
To: moishe@langsam.com, CheriUnger@aol.com, korerc@earthlink.net, 
        cyberpass@worldnet.att.net, saturne@generation.net, 
        barbara.lack@usa.net, The2thdkdr@aol.com, acheynueve@aol.com, 
        liz_roth@hotmail.com, mkulik@informent.com, avrofek@netvision.net.il, 
        dadmoni@nertvision.net.il 
Subject: Vranov 


Dear fellow Vranov researchers,


I have sent the translation of the Vranov tombstones for posting on the
H-SIG web site, but it hasn't appeared yet so I have attached an excel
spread sheet with the translations.


Let me know if you want a copy of any of the photos.


I am researching Reiss, Weiss, Roth, Neuman, Heimowitz,  so if you have
any of these names in your tree I would also like to hear from you.



Bobby Furst
Redondo Beach, CA
____________________________________________________________

Date: Sun, 23 Jan 2000 12:00:08 -0800 
From: Bobby Furst <bobby1st@sprynet.com> 
Reply-To: bobby1st@sprynet.com 
To: "moishe@langsam.com" <moishe@langsam.com> 
Subject: Re: Vranov 

Moishe,

What I have sent to H-SIG for posting is just the translations, not the photos
themselves.  I have attached the photo GIF for #90 to this message and you can
post it to your web site yourself.


Bobby


"moishe@langsam.com" wrote:


> Hi,
> Many, many thanks for all your hard effort. I found one tombstone, #90, for
> Gittel Miller. When you post to the net, perhaps you would consider putting
> a link from her tombstone photo to her page in my site. My site is
> www.langsam.com
> and her specific link is at
> http://www.ics.uci.edu/~dan/genealogy/Miller/shabsib.htm#L1.2.2.3
> Anyhow, your preservation of their memories is a "mitzvah".
> Let me know when you do post so that I can link her to a copy of the actual
> tombstone.
> Thanks!!!
> -Moishe Miller
> moishe@langsam.com
____________________________________________________________


I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.

Moishe Miller
moishe@langsam.com

My home address is
           1374 East 28th Street
           Brooklyn NY 11210-5311
           USA

Last updated 1/23/00
